sections.heading: against county; delinquent personal tax; offset
sections.text: In any suit against a county, any delinquent personal taxes assessed against the person in whose favor the cause of action accrued, may be set off against any amount claimed in such action.SourceLaws 1879, ยง 50, p. 369;R.S.1913, ยง 975;C.S.1922, ยง 875;C

sections.heading: permissive, and does not deprive board of power to deduct the amount of taxes from a judgment rendered in district court
sections.text: State ex rel. Hershiser v. Holt County, 89 Neb. 445, 131 N.W. 960 (1911).
